page.title: 13CROSS-COUNTRY, BEDGEBURY
page.content: Cross-country running is popular, whether competitive (individual or team), recreational or, for example, as practice for marathons. Bedgebury area is good for cross- country running (or walking or riding) as it has many footpaths, tracks and country roads; variety in forest, field and parkland; and the gently hilly terrain of the High Weald. Bedgebury School has house and school cross-country matches; joggers use the roads and tracks; orienteering events are held in the Forest. Competitive cross-country has rules, such as the English Schools' Athletic Association's, governing distance for age, scoring, course marking, race control etc. Junior boys (13-14) run 4-4.5 km, girls 2.5-3; intermediates (15-16) 5-5.5/3-3.5. Winning team has lowest aggregate place-number score.
